Stephen first ran for the [[Progressive Conservative Association of Alberta|Progressive Conservatives]] in the February 1982 by-election in [[Olds-Didsbury]] that saw [[Gordon Kesler]] from the [[Western Canada Concept]] elected. He was defeated running a distant third behind [[Alberta Social Credit Party]] candidate [[Lloyd Quantz]].
Stephen won the [[Alberta general election, 1982|1982 general election]] months later, and served the riding of for one term in office from 1982 to 1986 as the first Conservative elected to the riding.
Stephen is famous for making controversial remarks about repression in [[China]].
